To track this down, start python and type:

 >>> import sys
 >>> sys.path

You should see something like this:

['', '/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.5/lib/ 
python25.zip', '/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.5/lib/ 
python2.5', '/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.5/lib/ 
python2.5/plat-darwin', '/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/ 
Versions/2.5/lib/python2.5/plat-mac', '/Library/Frameworks/ 
Python.framework/Versions/2.5/lib/python2.5/plat-mac/lib- 
scriptpackages', '/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.5/ 
lib/python2.5/lib-tk', '/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/ 
2.5/lib/python2.5/lib-dynload', '/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/ 
Versions/2.5/lib/python2.5/site-packages']
 >>>

Verify that the "site-packages" directory is included in this list.   
Then go to that directory, and verify that there is a directory  
"Cantera" within it.  If it is not there, you need to rebuild Cantera.


Dave



On May 16, 2007, at 12:16 PM, rustoleump wrote:

> I continue to receive the following error:
>
> Traceback (most recent call last):
>   File "/Applications/Cantera/demos/python/flames/ 
> adiabatic_flame.py", line 5, in
> <module>
>     from Cantera import *
> ImportError: No module named Cantera
>
> I had successfully installed from CVS on my Mac (iBook 10.4.9, ppc,  
> MacPython 2.5,
> numarray 1.5.2, gcc, sundials) and successfully run several python  
> files (flame1.py,
> flame2.py).  I then moved on to run a modified version of the  
> adiabatic_flame.py file for
> my particular case.  This is when I first received this error.  I  
> have executed the source
> command stated at the end of the install and verified that my PATH  
> has what I think is
> required:
>
> /Applications/Cantera/bin:/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/ 
> Versions/Current/
> bin:/opt/local/bin:/opt/local/sbin:/usr/local/bin:/usr/local/ 
> graphviz-2.12/bin:/
> Applications:/usr/local:/Applications/MATLAB73/bin:/bin:/sbin:/usr/ 
> bin:/usr/sbin
>
> I also tried several files in MATLAB (flame, flame1, ignite, and  
> others) and all had an error
> with gri30 and IdealGasMix.
>
> I imagine I've missed something somewhere along the line, but I  
> don't know where.  It
> seems odd to me that it worked for several files then stopped.  In  
> perhaps a somewhat
> hasty response, I deleted the Cantera folder under Applications and  
> re-installed Cantera.  I
> continue to receive the same error.  Does anyone have any ideas on  
> how to remove this
> error?  Thanks.
>
